intro: Sabatia angularis, commonly known as angular sabatia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves and showy pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wet meadows. It blooms from June to September and is often found in open habitats with partial shade. Sabatia angularis is an important nectar source for various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
